results.p: Aug 25, 2024 — 1. to talk in a noisy, excited, or declamatory manner 2. to scold vehemently transitive verb : to utter in a bombastic declamatory fashion.

results.t: RANT | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: Meaning of rant in English ... to speak, write or shout in a loud, uncontrolled, or angry way, often saying confused or silly things: He's always ranting (on) ...
A rant is an argument that is fueled by passion, not shaped by facts. When the shouting starts on talk radio, or when a blog commenter resorts to ALL CAPS, ...
verb (used without object). to speak or declaim extravagantly or violently; talk in a wild or vehement way; rave: The demagogue ranted for hours.
to talk loudly and in a way that shows anger : to complain in a way that is unreasonable. [no object]. “You can rant and rave all you want,” she said, ...

results.t: RANT definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: rant in American English · 1. to talk or say in a loud, wild, extravagant way; declaim violently; rave. noun · 2. ranting speech · 3. Scottish and North England.
